description.value:
Hermits, shamans, and wild people. Druids learn magic from nature, spirits, and elemental forces. They are often strongly aligned with nature or animals.

The druid is a powerful spellcaster using their powers to shape the environment around them. Unlike the baseline 5e druid, our druid has powerful environmental control effects, and animal shapeshifting is an optional class feature. Most existing 5e subclasses will all work mechanically with this form of the druid class. Click @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.VLxJ80DY7q7hkXU7.JournalEntryPage.QjLATbZ1uI3tAwjs#druid]{here} for a summary of changes.

Level 1 Druids

When you create a level 1 Druid, you will need to manually add your ability scores. You will gain the rest of the following automatically:

Recommended Ability Scores

You can take one of these recommended ability score arrays, or you can roll or assign them yourself. You can switch any two ability scores, but you do not add any further bonuses (they're already included).

&reference[Strength]: 8 &reference[Dexterity]: 14 &reference[Constitution]: 16 &reference[Intelligence]: 10 &reference[Wisdom]: 16 &reference[Charisma]: 10

or

Strength: 9 Dexterity: 14 Constitution: 14 Intelligence: 14 Wisdom: 16 Charisma: 8

Feat

You gain a level 1 @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.lGAvinVvDjAXzQ1Q]{feat} of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.â€‹

Hit Points

Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + Constitution Modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d8 per druid level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.pHlopVD36uBfquJF]{Medium Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.NLDdf7iJt09G64Dg]{Scimitars}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.0hIX4VFLMTXWVYoW]{Shortswords}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{Tools}: two, which can be @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#crafting-tools]{Crafting Tools} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.lExi8Y6jXHBv8vd2]{Navigator's Tools}
Saving Throws: &Reference[Intelligence], &Reference[Wisdom]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.rv19GFzEa0nMTuAF]{Skills}: Choose two from &Reference[Arcana], &Reference[Animal Handling], &Reference[Insight], &Reference[Medicine], &Reference[Nature], &Reference[Perception], &Reference[Religion], and &Reference[Survival]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID]{Languages}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID.JournalEntryPage.VZggCkMcvhk0X5Xj#druidic]{Druidic}

Items

You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.O8vBudyTBZs03cTF]{hide armor} -OR- @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.jSi9ralAm7FzUQbH]{padded armor}
  • a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.NLDdf7iJt09G64Dg]{scimitar}-OR- any @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS#simple-melee-weapons]{Simple Melee Weapons}
  • a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.AENiTUeluTRiFzRz]{large shield} -OR- any @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS#simple-melee-weapons]{Simple Melee Weapons}
  • two sets of @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{tools}, which you gained proficiency with as part of the druid class
  • a component pouch -OR- an arcane focus
  • an explorer's pack

Multiclass Characters

Instead of leveling up in your original class, you can take a druid level when you level up. When you do, you gain only a portion of what first level druids gain.

Multiclassing Ability Score Requirements

Taking levels in several classes requires exceptional ability. You must meet the multiclassing ability score requirements for both your original class and the class you are multiclassing into.

For druids you must have:

  • Wisdom: 14

Hit Points

Per Level: 1d8 (or 5) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d8 per druid level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.pHlopVD36uBfquJF]{Medium Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.NLDdf7iJt09G64Dg]{Scimitars}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.0hIX4VFLMTXWVYoW]{Shortswords}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN]{Tools}: two, which can be @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.SySQiDfSWcSRUCFN.JournalEntryPage.wuMEnZz82yY02Dok#crafting-tools]{Crafting Tools} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.lExi8Y6jXHBv8vd2]{Navigator's Tools}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID]{Languages}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.5l8QNlgPDPOHpGID.JournalEntryPage.VZggCkMcvhk0X5Xj#druidic]{Druidic}

Druid Advancement

advancement.title: Wild Shape
advancement.hint: You gain the ability to twist your environment to your will. You can use Wild Shape as a bonus action, causing one effect when you do. You can use this feature twice, regaining all uses at the end of a short or long rest. When you gain this feature, you pick two of the following wild shape options. When you finish a long rest, you can exchange one of your Wild Shape options for another of the same level. All of these effects count as magical, but they are not spells.

advancement.title: Advanced Wild Shape
advancement.hint: You gain the ability to draw upon the power of a group of animals. When you gain this feature, you pick one of the following wild shape options. When you finish a long rest, you can exchange one of your Wild Shape options for another of the same level. All of these effects count as magical, but they are not spells.

advancement.title: Greater Wild Shape
advancement.hint: You gain the ability to draw upon the power of the land, sea, or air. When you gain this feature, you pick one of the following wild shape options. When you finish a long rest, you can exchange one of your Wild Shape options for another of the same level. All of these effects count as magical, but they are not spells.
Choose two from Arcana, Animal Handling, Insight, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Religion, and Survival

advancement.title: Spells Prepared
advancement.hint: This list only shows 2nd level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium

advancement.title: Spells Prepared
advancement.hint: This list only shows 3rd level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium

advancement.title: Item
advancement.hint: hide armor -OR- padded armor

advancement.title: Item
advancement.hint: a scimitar-OR- any Simple Melee Weapons

advancement.title: Item
advancement.hint: a large shield -OR- any Simple Melee Weapons

advancement.title: Item
advancement.hint: two sets of tools, which you gained proficiency with as part of the druid class

advancement.title: Superior Ability
advancement.hint: You increase one ability score of your choice by 2, to a maximum of 22.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint:
At this level and every level you gain an ability score improvement, you also gain a feat of your choice. You are eligible for general feats and druid feats by default.
                You may be eligible for other feats, which you can drag from the appropriate compendium into this box below.
                
                Some feats have additional prerequisites. Check the description of a feat before choosing it.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint: You gain a level 1 feat of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.â€‹

advancement.title: Druid Circle
advancement.hint:
Choose a Druid Circle. This represents the traditions you followed to learn how to wield primal magic. Some druids are members of secret societies that call themselves druid circles, and some druids learn their magic from a single mentor or even magical creatures.
        
        Your Druid Circle gives you extra spells at this level and extra features at levels 3, 6, 10, and 14, also listed below.
        
         
        
        Druid circles published elsewhere are compatible with this version of the druid class, with the exception of circles that directly interact with shapeshifting, which may not be compatible.

For help converting a subclass to function with Elkan 5e, see the Elkan 5e Rules Compendium -> Help.
